summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeVeganThe e.l.f. Cosmetics Halo Glow Setting Powder is a loose setting powder that lightly veils the skin for that dreamy, airbrushed finish.
details: DetailsBenefitsLoose setting powder feels weightless feel on the skinCreates a soft glow without shineSmooths the look of pores and fine linesBlurs imperfections for a soft-focus lookFormulated with lab-crated Sapphire ParticlesTalc-freeProud to be 100% vegan and cruelty-free, worldwide. Because kindness is chic.Key IngredientsSapphire Particles: Lab-created and finely milled for a soft glowFormulated WithoutAll e.l.f. products are free from phthalates, parabens, nonylphenol ethoxylates, triclosan, triclocarban, and hydroquinoneAll skincare is also free from sulfatesItem 2574627How To UseSwirl a powder brush over the powder. Tap off the excess. Apply onto the face and neck to set makeup.Beauty Tip: Lightly dust powder on bare skin and apply a layer of foundation on top. This will help with oil control and provide a subtle glow under foundation.IngredientsLight: Polyisobutene, Bis-Diglyceryl Polyacyladipate-2, Octyldodecanol, Petrolatum, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Oil, Polyethylene, Pentaerythrityl Tetraisostearate, Neopentyl Glycol Diethylhexanoate, Pentaerythrityl Adipate/Caprate/Caprylate/Heptanoate, Isotridecyl Isononanoate, Isostearic Acid, Microcrystalline Wax (Cera Microcristallina), Dibutyl Lauroyl Glutamide, Dibutyl Ethylhexanoyl Glutamide, Caprylyl Glycol, Fragrance (Parfum), Tocopheryl Acetate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Triethoxycaprylylsilane, Hexyl Cinnamal, Linalool
how_to_use: Swirl a powder brush over the powder. Tap off the excess. Apply onto the face and neck to set makeup.Beauty Tip: Lightly dust powder on bare skin and apply a layer of foundation on top. This will help with oil control and provide a subtle glow under foundation.

reviews.headline: Nice Product
reviews.comments: Very nice product. Excellent setting powder. Just wish container was larger.

reviews.headline: Made me yellow
reviews.comments: I bought the pink shade and it ended up peeling off and got chunky on my face

reviews.headline: SO GOOD and waterproof & long lasting
reviews.comments: I genuinely have been struggling to find a good powder but I love this one so much, it is great for my dry skin because it doesnt dry me out. It looks natural and lasts long and I can sob and swim with it and it lasts. It's genuinely the best powder ive ever bought and I love it so much.

reviews.headline: Made me look sweaty, not glowy
reviews.comments: So this product is great, however it wasn't quite the result I wanted. I did find it worked to a certain extent and it does most of the things it claims to do, but since its not a translucent powder, i found that if i didn't meticulously blend out every crevice of my face, it would look cakey. Like you can't just use a brush like you would with any other powder and be done. It left the colored patches on my skin. And i felt like it didn't last. I would do my makeup and it would look good, then no more than 10 minutes later my skin was greasy, not glowy. I'm aware its supposed to leave a glow, but for people who have more oily or combination skin (i have combination) it doesn't work great. I would come home and look in the mirror for the first time in hours and something like my nose would be so oily that if you touched it with your finger it would leave the oiliness on your finger. That would happen even if i baked my face with it. Its just not for me but if you have dry skin it would probably work great, but it ended up just making my face look sweaty 90% of the time. But i will say it never felt heavy on my face and initially when i would put it on it made my makeup perfect. Its just not a long term product, you would have to reaplly a lot (at least i would have to). Hope this helps! (Im a teen by the way, so this is a teens perspective i dont know if that helps your opinion in any way, but i just thought id mention it)

reviews.headline: No more white cast!
reviews.comments: In lovw with this powder, never looking back to all my other million ones haha

reviews.headline: A Staple In My Collection!!!
reviews.comments: I had removed this from my collection and just recently bought it again due to the dryness of this summer in NYC and wow do I still love it! If you have large pores, apply with a powder puff and it looks flawless!

reviews.headline: Repurchased Multiple Times
reviews.comments: By far my favorite setting powder ever. I have been using it for a couple of years now and it works well with a lot of different foundations. Blurs perfectly and doesn't cake up at any point in the day, even after any touchups.

reviews.headline: I was carded
reviews.comments: I wasn't expecting much from the price of this powder. The day I wore this I was carded at a restaurant.. I'm 36. I bought back-ups. It's lovely!

reviews.headline: Not for me!
reviews.comments: The packaging is fine but eventually a lot of powder comes out and its diffcult to use that way. Just wasnt for me, was too lightweight and didnt add much

reviews.headline: It's a no from me
reviews.comments: I was almost out of the elf soft luminescence HD powder and decided to try the halo glow loose powder instead as my replacement. Oh HECK NO. I actually ended up accidentally placing 2 of the halo glow powders in my cart (one pink and the other in light) and will be returning both promptly. The Halo Glow loose powder is super shimmery (almost frosted) and it exaggerated the heck out of any texture on my skin. It also has an almost clumpy/cakey looking texture and left a gummy (???) residue on my skin that felt tacky and seemed to leave me looking at least 14 yrs older. I tried both the pink and light colors with multiple combinations of sunscreens/moisturizers/primers with the same unpleasant results. I cannot get it to work for me. Maybe it's just my 42 year old skin that's the problem, but I will be exchanging both of these for the HD powder immediately!

reviews.headline: LOVE THIS!
reviews.comments: I bought this to try out since my normal setting powder was running out, I love it! I don't use the halo glow, but this powder still leaves me glowy without looking greasy/sweaty! I definitely recommend. It does crease under my eyes but I think that might just be a user error lol. Please buy!!

reviews.headline: NEW GO TO POWDER! ðŸ¤©
reviews.comments: This powder is absolutely amazing! Its within budget and makes your skin so smooth, also great on sensitive skin! Will definetly repurchase!

reviews.headline: NEW GO TO POWDER! ðŸ¤©
reviews.comments: This powder is absolutely amazing! Its within budget and makes your skin so smooth, also great on sensitive skin! Will definetly repurchase!

reviews.headline: Casey Mess
reviews.comments: I tried this product to set my under eyes and go in my T-zone which is how I use my loose powders and never had a problem. This product is so so so dry and cakey no matter what you do! I always prime and moisturize my eyes before adding makeup and this has kept my undereyes looking smooth. It doesn't matter with this powder. In my T-zone it doesnt asorb oil at all, it looks greasy and separates in a way that makes it look like small globs. Under the eyes it clings to every small crevice and looks so dry even straight after application. In short it looks terrible on application and even worse throughout the day! I've tried using a puff, sponge and brush and it doesn't matter. Waste of money.

reviews.headline: Great product
reviews.comments: The halo glow powder has a nice scent didn't leave cakeiness and overall smelled subtle and had a nice shimmer to it.

reviews.headline: Like it but not as a setting powder
reviews.comments:
If I use this under the eye, because it is so shimmery it brings out the blues and purples from my dark circles. Compare that to the Maybelline Fit Me Podwer, which provides a smooth matte veil from the talc. Also i notice that the elf halo glow powder will bunch up and separate the foundation after a couple hours of wear. 

I recommend using it as a finishing powder to bring some glow back to the face, not as a setting powder.

reviews.headline: Please make a non shimmery version
reviews.comments: This is my favorite powder ever! Even better than other high ende faves but I cannot use it because I hate shimmery powders. Please make one without!! < 3

reviews.headline: The best setting powder for under eyes
reviews.comments: I've tried so many powders, High end and drug store brands, after watching many influencers recommending different powders for under eyes. I have fine wrinkles and I'm a 50 yr old and all those powders made my under eyes worse, except for this one. I took a break from this powder since it was almost out and went back to it yesterday and it totally blew my mind away. I need stock up in this before it goes up!

reviews.headline: Cake City
reviews.comments: I cannot understand why this has such positive reveiws cause omgggg noooo! Jist terribel! Itd so patchy, chalky, ans cakey. It's the worst. I was so embarrassed by how my face looked when I looked in the mirror in a public restroom. I literally drove back home to wash my face. Yes, it's that bad. I threw it away.

reviews.headline: Cake City
reviews.comments: I cannot understand why this has such positive reveiws cause omgggg noooo! Jist terribel! Itd so patchy, chalky, ans cakey. It's the worst. I was so embarrassed by how my face looked when I looked in the mirror in a public restroom. I literally drove back home to wash my face. Yes, it's that bad. I threw it away.

Works great just over face cream

media.headline: Amazing pigment!
media.caption: Follow my MUA page @slayed_imperfections on Instagram

media.headline: It's giving beauty filter!
media.caption: full coverage, airbrushed, flawless finish thanks to Halo Glow Setting Powder!

media.headline: Amazing
media.caption: Dry skin but halo glow setting powder leaves it nice and natural look!

faceoff_positive.comments: I have pretty dry skin and because this powder has the tiniest bit of a glow it is perfect for me. It also the BEST sifter turning mechanism for such an affordable powder. Even high end powders don't have something this unique, so it is sad to travel with and you won't have powder everywhere. I do wish they would add a few more shades, but I also know thy started with 3 and now there are more! You will love this!
faceoff_positive.headline: Best powder for dry skin

faceoff_negative.comments: I ordered meduim and received deep which was like the Park Ave Princess shimmer bronze on me. But it didn't blend out that great.
faceoff_negative.headline: Doesn't blend well
